item.title: 欧洲央行调查显示：欧元区商业环境改善，人工智能蓬勃发展
item.description: 欧洲央行周五对非金融企业的调查显示，欧元区企业的经营状况略有改善，但这仍表明增长幅度不大，即使一些行业（如人工智能）正在蓬勃发展。【原文：Euro zone firms are enjoying a slight improvement in business conditions but this still points to only modest growth, even if some sectors, such as AI, are booming, the ECB's survey of non-financial companies showed on Friday.】

item.title: 苹果和亚马逊业绩预期提振市场情绪，标普和纳斯达克指数期货上涨
item.description: 周五，美国 500 指数和纳斯达克指数上涨，此前苹果公司和亚马逊公司发布了乐观的业绩预测，帮助舒缓了市场的紧张情绪。【原文：S&P 500 and Nasdaq futures gained on Friday after upbeat forecasts from Apple and Amazon helped soothe nerves a day after the indexes logged their steepest drop in more than three weeks.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）称，福特将因门板和灯条缺陷在美国召回约 7.98 万辆汽车
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周五表示，福特汽车公司将在美国召回79781辆汽车，这些汽车前门附近的内饰板可能脱落，后车灯可能停止工作。【原文：Ford Motor is recalling 79,781 vehicles in the U.S. that are at risk of having interior panels near the front doors that could detach and rear lights that may stop working, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道信中显示：Nexperia暂停向中国组装厂供应晶圆
item.description: 路透社查阅的一封写给客户的信显示，荷兰芯片制造商 Nexperia 已暂停向其中国组装厂供应晶圆，此举可能加剧令全球汽车制造商担忧的供应紧张局面。【原文：Dutch chipmaker Nexperia has suspended supplies of wafers to its Chinese assembly plant, a letter addressed to its customers reviewed by Reuters showed, a move that could worsen a supply squeeze that is worrying automakers worldwide.】

item.title: 土耳其科技部称优步将向土耳其技术中心投资 2 亿美元
item.description: 土耳其工业和技术部周五表示，优步（Uber）将在五年内投资 2 亿美元，在伊斯坦布尔建立一个软件和技术开发中心。【原文：Uber will invest $200 million over five years in a software and technology development centre in Istanbul, Turkey's Industry and Technology Ministry said on Friday.】

item.title: 巴克莱认为欧洲央行在政策决定后不会在 2026 年底前进一步降息
item.description: 在欧洲央行周四维持利率不变后，巴克莱银行修改了对欧洲央行利率轨迹的预测，预计欧洲央行将在 12 月份的会议上保持利率稳定，而之前的观点是降息四分之一个点。【原文：Barclays revised its forecast for the European Central Bank's rate trajectory, expecting it to keep interest rates steady in its December meeting from its earlier view of a quarter point cut, after the ECB kept rates unchanged on Thursday.】

item.title: 英伟达将向韩国供应超过 26 万颗 Blackwell AI 芯片
item.description: 美国半导体龙头企业英伟达（Nvidia）周五表示，将向韩国政府和包括三星电子（Samsung Electronics）在内的一些韩国最大企业提供超过 26 万片最先进的人工智能芯片。【原文：U.S. semiconductor leader Nvidia on Friday said it will supply more than 260,000 of its most advanced AI chips to South Korea's government and some of the country's biggest businesses, including Samsung Electronics .】

item.title: 三星电子称正与英伟达洽谈供应下一代 HBM4 芯片事宜
item.description: 三星电子（Samsung Electronics）周五表示，正在 "密切讨论 "向英伟达（Nvidia）供应其下一代高带宽内存（HBM）芯片或 HBM4 的事宜，因为这家韩国芯片制造商正努力在人工智能芯片竞赛中追赶竞争对手。【原文：Samsung Electronics said on Friday it is in "close discussion" to supply its next-generation high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, or HBM4, to Nvidia , as the South Korean chipmaker scrambles to catch up with rivals in the AI chip race.】

item.title: 日本 Seven & i 公司寻求并购交易和合作以促进增长
item.description: 日本 Seven & i 公司首席财务官 Yoshimichi Maruyama 周五表示，该公司正在实施多项计划，其中包括潜在的并购交易和合作伙伴关系，旨在实现大幅增长。【原文：Japan's Seven & i is working on several initiatives that include potential M&A deals and partnerships aimed at leading to substantial growth, Chief Financial Officer Yoshimichi Maruyama said on Friday.】

item.title: 早间竞价市场无花招，有惊喜
item.description: 安库尔-班纳吉（Ankur Banerjee）对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 日本央行锁定近期加息，日元可能左右加息时机
item.description: 日本央行谨慎的行长异常鹰派地暗示将在 12 月或明年 1 月加息，而加息时间可能不仅受到工资增长势头的影响，还受到日元走势的影响。【原文：The Bank of Japan's cautious governor has dropped unusually hawkish hints of an interest rate hike in December or January next year, with the timing likely swayed not just by wage momentum but by moves in the yen.】

item.title: 谈判失败后，ESPN、ABC 和其他迪士尼电视网退出 YouTube TV
item.description: 谷歌的 YouTube TV 周四表示，在两家公司未能达成新的授权协议后，迪斯尼旗下的电视网（包括 ESPN 和 ABC）已在其平台上停播。【原文：Google's YouTube TV said on Thursday Disney's networks, including ESPN and ABC, have gone dark on its platform after the two companies failed to reach a new licensing deal.】

item.title: 安杜里尔在澳大利亚开设工厂制造海底 "鬼鲨 "无人机
item.description: 美国防务公司 Anduril Industries 周五在悉尼开设了一家新的制造工厂，生产被称为 "鬼鲨 "的水下无人机，并履行与澳大利亚海军签订的 17 亿澳元（11 亿美元）的供应合同。【原文：U.S. defence firm Anduril Industries on Friday opened a new manufacturing facility in Sydney to produce undersea drones known as “Ghost Sharks” and deliver on its A$1.7 billion ($1.1 billion) supply contract with Australia’s navy.】

item.title: 亚洲股市有望连续第七个月上涨；美元攀升
item.description: 亚马逊和苹果公司的乐观财报提振了华尔街的期货市场，美元因美联储进一步降息的不确定性在三个月高位附近徘徊，周五亚洲股市将迎来连续第七个月的上涨。【原文：Asian shares are set for a seventh straight month of gains on Friday, after upbeat earnings from Amazon and Apple buoyed Wall Street futures and the dollar hovered near three-month highs on uncertainty over further Federal Reserve rate cuts.】

item.title: 采购经理人指数显示中国工厂活动连续第七个月萎缩
item.description: 周五的一项官方调查显示，10月份中国工厂活动连续第七个月萎缩，进一步刺激经济以拉动内需的呼声持续高涨，而将货物运往国外的努力只是在输出价格战。【原文：China's factory activity shrank for a seventh month in October, an official survey showed on Friday, keeping alive calls for further stimulus to boost domestic demand, with efforts to ship goods abroad merely exporting price wars.】

item.title: 市场对前景感到困惑，美元创三个月新高
item.description: 周五亚市早盘，美元在触及三个月高点后持稳，因为交易员们在处理本周央行决议、科技行业财报和中美暂定关税休战所发出的混合信号。【原文：The U.S. dollar held its ground in early Asian trade on Friday after reaching a three-month high as traders processed mixed signals from this week's central bank decisions, tech sector earnings and a tentative U.S.-China tariff truce.】

item.title: 美元走强，供应充足，石油将迎来第三次月度下跌
item.description: 由于美元走强抑制了大宗商品的涨幅，同时全球主要产油国的供应增加抵消了西方对俄罗斯出口制裁的影响，周五油价有所回落，连续第三个月下跌。【原文：Oil prices eased on Friday, heading for a third straight monthly decline, as a stronger dollar capped commodities gains while rising supply from major producers globally offset the impact of Western sanctions on Russian exports.】

item.title: 澳大利亚明星娱乐公司第一季度亏损连续收窄
item.description: 澳大利亚陷入困境的赌场集团 Star Entertainment 周五连续收窄了第一季度的亏损，原因是悉尼的交易趋于稳定，黄金海岸的交易量也随季节性增长而增加。【原文：Australian embattled casino group Star Entertainment on Friday narrowed its first-quarter loss sequentially due to stabilised trading in Sydney and seasonally stronger volumes on the Gold Coast.】

item.title: 电动汽车结束了中国节假日汽油使用量激增的惯例
item.description: 蒋天宇（音译）本月在中国国庆长假期间进行了一次 2000 公里（1200 英里）的公路旅行，首次驾驶电动汽车从西南部的四川盆地抵达北京。【原文：Tianyu Jiang took a 2,000-km (1,200-mile) road trip this month during China's national holiday week, driving in his electric vehicle from the southwestern Sichuan basin to Beijing for the first time.】

item.title: 失衡加剧，中国发出转向消费的信号
item.description: 中国过度依赖投资和出口为其 19 万亿美元的经济提供动力，这似乎已经达到了极限。【原文：China's over-reliance on investment and exports to power its $19 trillion economy appears to have reached a limit.】

item.title: 经济学家估计美国每周申请失业救济人数下降
item.description: 据经济学家周四估计，上周新申请失业救济金的美国人数有所下降，但由于企业不愿增加招聘，下岗人员的新工作机会仍然很少。【原文：The number of Americans filing new applications for unemployment benefits fell last week, economists estimated on Thursday, though new job opportunities for those who are laid off remained scarce amid a reluctance by businesses to boost hiring.】

item.title: 独家报道Netflix 找银行探讨竞购华纳兄弟发现公司事宜
item.description: 据三位熟悉内情的消息人士透露，Netflix 正在积极探索竞购华纳兄弟发现公司的工作室和流媒体业务，并聘请了一位财务顾问和获取财务信息。【原文：Netflix is actively exploring a bid for Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming business, retaining a financial advisor and gaining access to financial information, according to three sources familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 受人工智能需求推动，Atlassian 预计第二季度营收高于预期
item.description: 周四，Atlassian 预测第二季度营收将高于预期，并押注随着企业升级整合人工智能，其企业软件服务将迎来强劲需求，这使得其股价在延时交易中上涨了近 7%。【原文：Atlassian forecast second-quarter revenue above estimates on Thursday, betting on strong demand for its enterprise software services as businesses upgrade to integrate artificial intelligence, sending its shares up nearly 7% in extended trading.】

item.title: 需求强劲，First Solar 第三季度销售额超出预期
item.description: 受产品需求强劲的推动，First Solar 周四公布的第三季度销售额超出预期，股价在盘后交易中上涨超过 5%。【原文：First Solar beat expectations for third-quarter sales on Thursday, driven by robust demand for its products, sending its shares up more than 5% in extended trading.】

item.title: 美国前官员称，美国推迟对华出口限制可能会使其失效
item.description: 美国前官员表示，中国在周四与美国总统唐纳德-特朗普举行首脑会谈后宣布，华盛顿决定推迟实施对中国公司出口限制的规定，这可能会使该措施最终失效。【原文：Washington's decision to delay a rule on export restrictions for Chinese companies, announced by China after Thursday's summit meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump, could end up making the measure ineffective, former U.S. officials said.】

item.title: 美国支持的抵押贷款巨头房利美在各部门裁员超过 62 人
item.description: 美国联邦住房金融局局长威廉-普尔特（William Pulte）周四表示，美国政府资助的抵押贷款企业房利美（Fannie Mae）已在信息技术、多元化、公平与包容等部门裁员超过 62 人。【原文：U.S. government-sponsored mortgage enterprise Fannie Mae has cut more than 62 jobs across departments, including Information Technology, and Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, Federal Housing Finance Agency Director William Pulte said on Thursday.】

item.title: 战略公司因比特币收益实现季度盈利，股价上涨
item.description: 由于加密货币行业景气度的改善使这家比特币最大的企业受益，战略公司在第三季度实现了盈利，而去年同期则出现了亏损，这使其股价在收盘后上涨了近 4%。【原文：Strategy posted a profit in the third quarter, compared with a loss a year earlier, as improving sentiment around the cryptocurrency sector benefited the largest corporate holder of bitcoin, sending its shares up nearly 4% after the bell.】

item.title: 云存储需求增长，西部数据预测季度盈利强劲
item.description: 西部数据（Western Digital）周四预计第二季度盈利将高于华尔街预期，押注云计算提供商提高数据中心容量后对其数据存储产品的更高需求。【原文：Western Digital forecast second-quarter earnings above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, betting on higher demand for its data storage products as cloud providers increase data center capacity.】

item.title: 澳大利亚澳新银行下半年利润减少逾 7.21 亿澳元
item.description: 澳大利亚澳新银行（ANZ）周五警告称，该银行下半年的税后盈利将受到11.1亿澳元（7.2128亿美元）的冲击，原因是该银行计入了与重组和监管和解等事项相关的一次性费用。【原文：Australia's ANZ warned on Friday that its second-half earnings would take a hit of A$1.11 billion ($721.28 million) after tax, as the lender booked one-off charges tied to matters including restructuring and regulatory settlements.】

item.title: 特朗普核试验令或将促进霍尼韦尔、BWX Technology 等公司的发展
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统下令国防部开始进行核武器试验，这可能会给少数几家主导美国核武器基础设施的专业公司带来价值数十亿美元的合同。【原文：President Donald Trump's order for the Defense Department to start testing nuclear weapons could lead to billions of dollars' worth of contracts for a handful of specialized companies that dominate the United States' nuclear weapons infrastructure.】
